ARABIC: فَلَا تَعْلَمُ نَفْسٌ مَّآ أُخْفِىَ لَهُم مِّن قُرَّةِ أَعْيُنٍ جَزَآءًۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No self knows the delight that is hidden away for it in recompense for what it used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: No soul knows what peace and joy lie hidden from them as reward for what they have done.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: No one knows what delights of the eyes are kept hidden for them as a reward for their deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: No soul knows what delight awaits them as the reward for their deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So no soul knows the comfort of the eyes that is kept hidden for them*; the reward of their deeds. (Paradise)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: No person knows what is kept hidden for them of delights of eyes as a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So no soul knows what is hidden for them of that which will refresh the eyes; a reward for what they did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No soul knows what comfort is laid up for them secretly, as a recompense for that they were doing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: No soul knoweth what is kept hid for them of joy, as a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: No soul knows what joy is kept hidden in store for them as a reward for their labours.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: No soul knoweth that which is kept hidden for them of perfect comfort as a recompense for that which they have been working.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No one knows what delights have been kept hidden for them [in the Hereafter] as a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Now no person knows what delights of the eye are kept hidden (in reserve) for them - as a reward for their (good) deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: No person knows what is kept hidden for them of joy as a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No soul knows what pleases the eye is in store for them as a recompense for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: No soul knows what eye’s delight awaits them—a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And no soul knows what has been hidden for them of comfort for eyes as reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [32:17] For no soul knows what has been kept hidden for them in the way of joyous sights (a variant reading [for ukhfiya] has the imperfect tense ukhfī) as a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (No soul knoweth what is kept hid for them) what is prepared and stored for them (of joy) of gladness of the soul, reward and honour in Paradise, (as a reward for what they used to do) in the life of this world of good works.
